name: The Dream Machine: Chapter 1 & 2
description: The Dream Machine is an award-winning adventure game about dreams and voyeurism. It's built by hand using materials such as clay, cardboard and broccoli.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows XP or laterProcessor: 1.8 GHz processorMemory: 1 GB RAMHard Drive: 1 GB HD spaceAdditional Notes: Mouse recommended

reviews.review_text: I'm not usually someone who gets into point-and-clicks - I usually get stuck or bored talking to people and I'm too guilty to use walkthroughs but I made it through the first 3 chapters with only one less-than-ovious head-scratching moment.  It's weird to look at, weird to play and so probably not for everyone but I love it - it's has a great balance of creepy and mysterious and it's quite original in places too.  Puzzles are tricky sometimes but there are no red herrings (tho I've no idea about the bench in Chapter 3!) and everything you need is reasonably easy to find if you look in the right places. There are oo tiny changes in the cursor or 2-pixel-wide items - movement is quick - no convoluted dialogues to dig through - you mostly just play the game instead of walking, talking and so on.  Update: since writing that I've tried Chapter 4 and - unfortunately - I keep running into a crash bug which leaves me unable to continue. This isn't ideal but hopefully the developer will address it/I'll figure out a different way around the problem - and the puzzles do seem a LOT harder in this episode too! :(

This game has been in development for about 5 years now, so far 5 out of the planned 6 chapters have been finished. The reason it has taken so long is that the entire game is being built -by hand- with real materials like cardboard, clay and wood. It is absolutely beautiful, as you can probably imagine. Not only that, but the story AND the writing are both terrific! I'd say that almost all the puzzles hold some sense of logic to them, but as this is a game about entering people's dreams, it somewhat fittingly DOES start to lose some of it's sanity with it's puzzles (as is the case with all adventure games unfortunately). I had to use a walkthrough a few times to complete it, but that's the case with pretty much any adventure game I've ever played...  I absolutely recommend playing this! It's not finished yet, and based on how long it's taken to get the first 5 chapters out, it seems like we'll be waiting a while yet for the ending, but it's a wait very much worth enduring!

Oh boy, would I recommend The Dream Machine. I've just recently gotten into point-and-clicks and I think this just set a high standard and it's going to be hard to find a game that beats it. The wait for Chapter 6 is going to be painful, especially because the devs post teasers on their  Twitter . As an artist, this is a game to appreciate, and as someone who enjoys 'darker' art, it's a smorgasbord.   Reasons why you need it:  + Devs are very responsive to cries for help with glitches + Art style is incredible and obviously takes a lot of work + Puzzles are really tough + Puzzles are innovative and different + Chapter format makes it easier to appreciate in moderation instead of doing a binge + It's easy to binge  There are some little glitches here and there, but your love for the game will overpower them. Community for this game is great as well. There are no cons, really. Although, I would love to see some dynamic backgrounds.
Great adventure game. Best adventure game I've played since Mechanarium. Definitely check this out. They are releasing the 4th out of 5 chapters in August. I can't wait!

After playing the demo and reading reviews I had high hopes for The Dream Machine and I certainly wasn't disappointed.  The game is beautiful, the story, visuals and audio are brilliant (I would sometimes get Mr Morton's jazz music stuck in my head for hours after playing). The puzzles vary in difficulty and there were definitely times when I felt stuck, but not to the point where I didn't want to continue playing. I can't wait to see what chapter six brings!  This game is a must-have for point and click adventure game fans, I would 100% recommend.

Excellent original game, it will have you clicking/guiding a clay man around for weeks if you're not up to scratch on problem solving & out of the box thinking. If you want to gain some IQ or troubleshooting skills then take a crack at this.

This game is one of the best Puzzle Games i've ever played. The musical score is epic, the gameplay is fantastic and the puzzles are amazing. If you like a challenging yet rewarding puzzle game, get this. Don't miss it. You won't regret it

Hmm...I could reiterate most of what the reviews say but the machine wouldn't like that. It's creepy, inventive, challenging and some how dream like, or is it really a nightmare? Play it and find out for yourself!
Great story, stunning visuals, well written and atmospheric.

A truly amazing game. The art speaks for itself, and the soundtrack compliments the atmosphere perfectly - disturbing in a way that you can't quite put your finger on (until chapter 3, when you most certainly can). The game doesn't really show its true potential until you hit chapter 3; from then on, the puzzles (especially in chapter 5) and environments (especially in chapter 4) are top-notch. There's something wonderfully Real about the dialogue, too - it's easy to believe these characters and their stories and neuroses.

The visuals were very aesthetically pleasing; the claymation style was something I haven't seen in a game before. It is an interesting puzzle game, but can be quite challenging when the puzzles needed really creative thinking to solve. Overall a fun, casual game for anyone who wants to take it easy with a point-and-click puzzler with a great visual style.

This is an amazingly well made and gripping Indie game; especially if you like puzzles! The visual design and soundtrack of this game really cement it as a five-star game for me; whilst storyline is nice it's not always everything and The Dream Machine goes that step further by looking and sounding amazing. I can confidently advise you that this is well worth paying for, it's a lot of fun and you can see how much hard work the dev team have put into every part of it! *****
This game is just amazing. Absolutely worth a try. One of the best puzzle games i've ever played.

A point and click adventure game for those that like claymation and darker storylines. The plot is interesting (and dark) and well written. The puzzles can be a bit of a reach sometimes, but for the most part they are solvable.

This game is amazing! Currently on chapter 2. Do yourself a favor an get this game now! I purchased the chapter 1 and 2 pack an about 30 mins later bought all the other chapters. Wishing I had just bought the complete bundle lol. I usaually dont play games like this but this game is a gem. I love the story and the art is amazing! Also some very fun an challenging puzzles. Just buy it!

I have over 600 games in my Steam account, and the vast majority of them are still unplayed. So now I'm dedicating an hour to each of these games and writing a series of One Hour Reviews. An hour isn't very long to judge a game on, so think of this as more of a first impression, and take this review in the spirit in which it's given. Be sure to read other reviews from players who have spent more time in the game.   One Hour Reviews #50 - The Dream Machine  Before I started my series of reviews, I hadn't really played much in the way of adventure games. But, it's been nice seeing a resurgence in this genre, and now I've had the opportunity to play through several adventure games.  Going in, I didn't know anything about The Dream Machine. So playing it felt a little like going to a movie that you didn't see the trailer for, and you don't even know what genre of movie it is. And I'm glad I did that because I feel like I've just watched the opening act of a mystery, so not knowing anything ahead of time definitely added to that sense of mystery.  I won't spoil anything about the story, other than to say I enjoyed the first chapter, which I just had time to finish in my first hour of play. The story kept me engaged enough that by the time I noticed the time my playthough was nearly over. I think this is one of the better compliments you can give a game when it has that ability to suck you in.  The actual gameplay itself seems fairly typical for a point and click adventure game. It involves a lot of walking around, doing some pixel hunting to find points of interest, and picking up things that you'll need to use later. Pretty much everything I could pick up I ended up using on something, and often in ways I would not have expected. Besides the 'use this item on this thing' type of puzzle, I also played a different kind of puzzle that involved turning knobs on a machine.  I did occasionally have some trouble lining up my mouse cursor on the right pixel to pick something up, but it didn't happen often enough to be really annoying. Also, when you move the mouse to the top of the screen, a bar will pop down with your inventory, but sometimes this interferes with you trying to point to something at the top of the screen. Other than these couple of minor annoyances, I didn't really run into any problems with the game.  Besides the story, I also enjoyed the art style. Most of the adventure games I've played have an animated, cartoon like art style. But this game has a claymation inspired art style which really sets it apart. I can really tell a lot of work went into the art for this game. The characters look great, and so do the backgrounds. Everything has this hand crafted look to it.  I'm not sure if the following chapters are any longer to play, but I could see some potential concern about the game being relatively short (for what you pay for it). There are 6 chapters total (but the 6th is not out yet). I wouldn't be surprised if the follow on chapters take a little longer than an hour to get through. For me personally it's not an issue, as I think the game is worth the price, and would happily recommend it.

A fantastic point n click game, that requires the player to actually think. The game has a very unique art style that compliments the sinister underpinnings of a very good story. Do yourself a favor and try somthing new and unique with the dream machine.

Enjoyed this game immensely. I played chapters 1-4. It's been years if not decades since i devoted time to a point-and-click adventure. I was not disappointed. Beautiful artwork, interesting, odd, and at times scary storyline. Great variety in puzzles, although some of them are downright cruel, and required me to go online to search for an answer. There are a few minor glitches and errors that will crash the game, so remember to save often.  Other than that, looking forward to the rest of the chapters. Up until now, I find The Dream Machine to be a solid 9/10 when it comes to classic adventure games.
Beautiful! This game is totally worth the 20 hours of gameplay! Not as well known as it should be!
Hauntingly beautiful game. Could not stop playing!
Many bugs and creshes but... THIS GAME IS F*****G BLILLIANT!!! Everything is beautiful in this game: design, animations, story... I can't wait to play episode 6!!!!!!!

'Weird, creepy, and slightly off-putting; I loved it!' 8/10  As with many of the games in my Steam catalog, I got this one in a bundle. Not being a huge fan of 'point and click' games I decided to give 'Dream Machine' and chance one rainy afternoon when I was bored with the usual third or first person shooters, and was pleasantly surprised with my discovery. For starters, the artistic direction that was chosen for this game suits the tone of the story perfectly and does nothing but add to the overall creepiness factor of the characters and the setting. The game is also pretty challenging at times and really makes you think. I almost felt like a detective while playing. I also found it refreshing that the game was broken up into several different chapters, each entirely different than the one that preceded it. Overall, the stories here are pretty interesting for a few hours, and for five dollars I can recommend 'Dream Machine' to those who are at this page right now, interested in this game, considering a new addition to their Steam catalog.

I just finished chapters 1- 4. This is one of the most creative games I have played... ever.     If you love creepy, eerie, and the psychologically thrilling then this should be right up your alley.    The music and graphics are tastefully creepy and intriguing.    The puzzles were well balanced. They stayed challenging but not so difficult that I had to constantly look at a walkthrough to progress.    It makes you want to keep playing more! The story is so interesting. In the beginning it is quite a mystery as to what is going on...   Overall I enjoyed it so much and I cannot think of anything to complain about thus far! I cannot wait for chapters 5 and 6!

Very fun and surreal. The humor is pretty funny and the horror is... actually kind of disturbing. While I can't say the dream portions opperate on actual dream logic, they can certainly make you forget that it doesn't, and figuring out the internal logic of each individual dream is pretty fun in itself. And I'd be lying if I said I didn't get a kick out of the subtle  The Prisoner  shoutout in Chapter 1.  I am, however, struck by how lucid the various dreamers are once you find them, not to mention weirdly capable of taking the whole bizzare scenario in stride. Then again, considering the sorts of things I'm able to take in stride in my own dreams that would weird the hell out of me in real life, I suppose they aren't quite so lucid after all. But this is neither the time nor place for those stories.  My only complaints are that A) a few of the puzzles are terribly inconveniant to complete, even after you've figured out the solution, you're given a hell of a runaround to actually put that solution into action. And B) the chapters are over too quickly. I hope the next two chapters are longer.
Very beautiful artstyle and the story is really engaging.
Loved the art and storyline. Mystery with a little horror. Looking forward to chapter six!

*Completed Chapter 5*  Phenomenal point and click adventure, one of the best I've ever played. Reminiscent of the likes of Beneath A Steel Sky in some aspects, but not in the way you'd think. Wonderfully immersive, handcrafted environments really give the game a different feel to the rest. The characters are not initially exciting but the dream sequences reveal emotional depths. The game is still suffering from infrequent crashing but there is an autosave - just make sure to save at milestone moments to avoid frustration. Definitely worth getting.

I rarely enjoy point and click games, but this is one of the most memorable and engaging games in my library. I absolutely love the visuals, the puzzles are clever, and the designers use the story to its full surrealistic fabulous potential. Highly recommended 10/10

A strange and alluring mixture of mystery and the bazaar. Telling a well developed story that I've anticipated each year as it was released in six chapters and am still waiting for the final part. From the beginning I decided it looked different so I bought the entire package of chapters and was not disappointed one bit. With an amazingly rich story that takes you into the horrors and fantasies of the subconscious dream space along with some of the most challenging and well thought out puzzles I've seen this is a must play experience. If it isn't the soulful soundtrack that gets you it's the stop motion animation and how well it's been translated into a point and click game. This game requires some seriously critical thinking and I think it's worth solving them yourself hence my 25 hours playing the game. Trust me I'd tell you more but then I'd have to spoil the gameplay and you really don't want that.

If you like Adventures, BUY THIS. It has an amazing story line, the graphics are fantastic, controls are great.  One of the best adventures I have played so far (and I have played a lot over the last 20 years).  Thank you to the developers, I hope we see more of you guys in the future!
If you like point and click adventure games with a surreal dream-like atmosphere and unique hand-crafted artwork The Dream Machine is it. I can't recommend this game enough!
An amazing story, and great visuals. It can be extremely frustrating in Chaper 3, but continuing on for the story is a good idea. Worth the money!

I bought this game a few days before the Black Friday for around $14 (First I bought the Chapter 1+2, liked it, then bought the bundle). Usually in these kinds of situations I would feel really stupid that I forgot about such a big event and couldn't get it when it was on sale. But guess what: I have no regrets! The game is one of the best adventure games that I've played recently, so it's worth the full price. Highly recommended!

The Dream Machine is a nice, short point-and-click game with puzzles that make sense and a promising storyline. It's surprising that they managed to make reasonable graphics out of cardboard and modelling clay exclusively. The music is nice and soothing though it does give a bit of an eerie feel to the whole thing.   Unfortunately, there is no voice acting, a point where I do think there is room for improvement. There are only a couple of hours of gameplay (took me about 2 h to finish both chapter 1 and 2); this, however, will probably stop being a problem once all six chapters have been released.   Sure, I'd recommend this game to point-and-click puzzle lovers but be forewarned that it's a really short gameplay and you get no closure after finishing a chapter as it is 'to be continued...'.
Fun little game. Well worth the time and money. Still waiting on the next two chapters though.

Unquestionably, The Dream Machine's biggest selling point is its stop-motion animation style and aesthetics. It presents an almost surreal, otherworldly style that lends well to the game's focus on dreams. The story, while a bit dry and drawn out at times, is intriguing, light science fiction.  Many of the puzzles are your typical adventure game fare. Pick up this item, use it on this thing. Most puzzles aren't particuarly challenging, but most are intuitive enough that you won't be stuck for long. I admit to needing to check an FAQ once or twice, though.  Overall, it's definitely worth a look for fans of the adventure game genre. I wouldn't say it's worth the full price, but if you can get it on a decent sale, I would say get it.
:3 If you like point and click mysteries than this is for you ^^
Great game w/ awesome atmosphere!
All I can say is this game is weird
Awesome game. Can't wait for the last chapters!
Fun little game to puzzle your way through

Just finished chapter 5. This series is absolutely beautiful. You can tell how much time and effort the developer put into it. Each piece is handcrafted and shows so much love. Interesting story as well. My only issue with the game is that on occasion some steps in puzzles are a little unintuitive, however, many of the puzzles are clever and rational.
So a must buy. Love the art style and the game plays pulls you in instanly.

This piece of indie art is definetly worth your time if you're into exploring creative worlds, mysterious stories and meeting likeable characters. The first three chapters are really well done, looking forward to the remaining two.
This Game really AMAZING!!!! Cant wiat for the next Chapter :)
It's about time people started making some good point and clicks again. Looks great, the music is great! Get this game!
This game has a refreshing style and darkly unique story, while the game-play is point and click, the puzzles and quite involved and difficult forcing you to fully use your problem solving skills.
The most overlooked adventure game of all time. It has great puzzles, amazing visuals, a good story, and haunting atmosphere. Get it now.

This is the best point and click clay animation game. This is not a dead game, its' designer posts about news and bug fixes every other month. Still waiting for last episode.  Cute and dark ambient at the same time with different scenes. challenging puzzles, it is really not an easy peasy game Very good sound effects, soundtracks A fluent story, especially if you bought this game when it has only 1&2 episodes Replayable due to its complexity (after a decent amount of time) There is inspirational content about what a dream is how it looks and 'dream tech'

A very well made game. The storyline runs coherently, which always helps! There are plenty of puzzles to solve and I was able to finally work them out without needing any help apart from the last code at the end! The graphics are great and I haven't found any bugs. It will keep you engaged for hours.
So a must buy. Love the art style and the game plays pulls you in instanly.

I liked the art direction, though some of the characters look rather creepy (the protagonist's wife, for instance, looks like something from a horror movie). The story seems to be interesting so far. The puzzles are on the light side, and the game's first two chapters seemed to be very short, I finished them in about 2 hours. On the plus side, I haven't encountered a single bug in the first two chapters, so those seem to have been fixed. Still, can't really recommend it - mainly because the game is so short for the asking price.

Reminiscent of the games Amanita Design creates, And has the potential being as good as one.  Unfortunately, It's held back by countless of bugs, crashes, performance issues and inconsistencies.  That, coupled with the fact that the full game hasn't been released yet (At the time of writing, chapter 6 is not done) makes you feel like you're playing a early access game.  The story is great, the puzzles are challenging but not frustratingly illogical and the artstyle has a lot of heart. But its techinal issues prevents me from recommending this game.
No voice acting, seems too low fi.
Point and click adventure game. Full of itself. Or if you prefer, genre savvy.
